quotes.name: Nelson Mandela
quotes.quote: A winner is a dremaer who never gives up.

quotes.name: Nikola Tesla
quotes.quote: The day science begins to study non-physical phenomena, it will make more progress in one decade than in all the previous centuries of its existence.

quotes.name: Arthur C. Clarke
quotes.quote: I’m sure the universe is full of intelligent life. It’s just been too intelligent to come here.

quotes.name: Albert Einstein
quotes.quote: I have no special talent. I am only passionately curious.

quotes.name: Eleanor Roosevelt
quotes.quote: The future belongs to those whi belive in the beauty of their dreams.

quotes.name: Albert Einstein
quotes.quote: Imagination is more important than knowledge. Knowledge is limited. Imagination encircles the world.

quotes.name: Martin Luther King Jr.
quotes.quote: Take the first step in faith. You don't have to see the whole staircase, just take the first step.

quotes.name: Socrates
quotes.quote: I cannot teach anybody anything, I can only make them think.

quotes.name: Marie Curie
quotes.quote: Nothing in life is to be feared, it is only to be understood. Now is the time to understand more, so that we may fear less.

quotes.name: Johannes Kepler
quotes.quote: Dreams pass into the reality of action. From the actions stems the dream again; and this interdependence produces the highest form of living.

quotes.name: Thomas Edison
quotes.quote: Our greatest weakness lies in giving up. The most certain way to succeed is always to try just one more time.

quotes.name: Aristotle
quotes.quote: It is the mark of an educated mind to be able to entertain a thought without accepting it.

quotes.name: Galileo Galilei
quotes.quote: All truths are easy to understand once they are discovered; the point is to discover them.

quotes.name: Isaac Newton
quotes.quote: If I have seen further it is by standing on the shoulders of giants.

quotes.name: Charles Darwin
quotes.quote: A man who dares to waste one hour of time has not discovered the value of life.

quotes.name: Leonardo da Vinci
quotes.quote: Iron rusts from disuse, stagnant water loses its purity, and in cold weather becomes frozen; even so does inaction sap the vigor of the mind.

quotes.name: Henry Ford
quotes.quote: Failure is simply the opportunity to begin again, this time more intelligently.

quotes.name: James Clerk Maxwell
quotes.quote: Thoroughly conscious ignorance is the prelude to every real advance in science.

quotes.name: Stephen Hawking
quotes.quote: The greatest enemy of knowledge is not ignorance, it is the illusion of knowledge.

quotes.name: Neil deGrasse Tyson
quotes.quote: Dream big and dare to fail. Don't let others limit your potential.

quotes.name: Carl Sagan
quotes.quote: Imagination will often carry us to worlds that never were. But without it we go nowhere.

quotes.name: Richard Feynman
quotes.quote: The first principle is that you must not fool yourself and you are the easiest person to fool.

quotes.name: John F. Kennedy
quotes.quote: The time to repair the roof is when the sun is shining.

quotes.name: Michael Faraday
quotes.quote: Nothing is too wonderful to be true, if it be consistent with the laws of nature.

quotes.name: Democritus
quotes.quote: The wise man should be prepared for everything that may happen, and the man of understanding knows that all things are possible.

quotes.name: Rene Descartes
quotes.quote: It is not enough to have a good mind; the main thing is to use it well.

quotes.name: Archimedes
quotes.quote: Give me a lever long enough and a fulcrum on which to place it, and I shall move the world.

quotes.name: J. Robert Oppenheimer
quotes.quote: Dreams and imagination are the only limits of what we can do.

quotes.name: Max Planck
quotes.quote: A new scientific truth does not triumph by convincing its opponents and making them see the light, but rather because its opponents eventually die and a new generation grows up that is familiar with it.

quotes.name: Erwin Schrodinger
quotes.quote: Those who have never seen the sky with eyes wide open in wonder and amazement will never understand the beauty of science.

quotes.name: Louis Pasteur
quotes.quote: Chance favors the prepared mind.

quotes.name: Benjamin Franklin
quotes.quote: An investment in knowledge pays the best interest.

quotes.name: Edward Jenner
quotes.quote: A dreamer is one who can only find his way by moonlight, and his punishment is that he sees the dawn before the rest of the world.

quotes.name: Gregor Mendel
quotes.quote: Dreams are the touchstones of our character.

quotes.name: Alfred Nobel
quotes.quote: In the field of observation, chance favors only the prepared mind.

quotes.name: Werner Heisenberg
quotes.quote: In science there is only physics; all the rest is stamp collecting.

quotes.name: Antoine Lavoisier
quotes.quote: The dream is the small hidden door in the deepest and most intimate sanctum of the soul.
